Summary Sam Bosch is the founder and president of Peregrin Financial Technologies that has for over two decades designed, manufactured and marketed consumer-activated, financial-transaction products and services for merchants, financial institutions and public organizations.  
 
Peregrin has been recognized four times by The Portland Business Journal as one of Oregon’s Top 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies. And Inc. Magazine, the “Entrepreneur’s Handbook”, has twice listed Peregrin as one of the U.S.’s fast growing private companies. 
 
In the past Sam developed self-service gasoline dispensing terminals for Standard Oil and fleet operators, cashless ATMs for merchant storefront locations, self-service ticketing terminals for AMC Theaters and MovieFone, theme-park ticketing terminals for Disney¬land and Universal Studios, ski-lift ticketing termimals for Killington in Vermont and Squaw Valley in California and ticketing terminals for the U.S. National Parks of Yel¬lowstone and Carlsbad Caverns. 
 
Sam brought to market SeguraCash, which repurposes non-EMV compliant ATM mechanism into Web-enabled cash dispensers saving them from junk yards. And recently Peregrin entered the smart-safe market, a cash-management product/service for merchants that allows them to deposit a day’s receipts into their bank accounts without counting the cash, filling out deposit slips and physically transporting cash to the bank. Peregrin strongly believes the Celent market forecast that states over 1,000,000 smart safes units will be installed in North America in the next five to seven years. 
 
Sam is a firm adherent of the advice that one Harvard Business School professor gives his students: "The three most important rules for success in business are: Avoid commodity products, Avoid commodity products, Avoid commodity products".  
 
Sam has been issued four cash logistics patents and is focused on exploiting this intellectual property by bringing innovative, non-commodity products to the market place.
